stdReg2 0.3.0
  • Reference

    Estimation of causal effects using stdReg2

    Provide tidy output from a std_glm object for use in downstream computations

    tidy.std_surv.Rd

    Tidy summarizes information about the components of the standardized regression fit.

    Usage

    # S3 method for std_surv
tidy(x, ...)

    Arguments

    x

    An object of class std_glm

    ...

    Not currently used

    Value

    A data.frame

    Examples

    require(survival)
set.seed(8)
n <- 300
Z <- rnorm(n)
X <- rnorm(n, mean = Z)
time <- rexp(n, rate = exp(X + Z + X * Z)) # survival time
C <- rexp(n, rate = exp(X + Z + X * Z)) # censoring time
U <- pmin(time, C) # time at risk
D <- as.numeric(time < C) # event indicator
dd <- data.frame(Z, X, U, D)
x <- standardize_coxph(
  formula = Surv(U, D) ~ X + Z + X * Z,
  data = dd, values = list(X = seq(-1, 1, 0.5)), times = c(2,3,4)
)

tidy(x)
#>      Estimate  Std.Error lower.0.95 upper.0.95 time contrast transform
#> 1  0.37425848 0.05636602 0.26378312  0.4847338    2     none  identity
#> 2  0.18100390 0.04207569 0.09853707  0.2634707    2     none  identity
#> 3  0.11371977 0.02911956 0.05664648  0.1707931    2     none  identity
#> 4  0.10190382 0.02572408 0.05148554  0.1523221    2     none  identity
#> 5  0.10122665 0.02449415 0.05321900  0.1492343    2     none  identity
#> 6  0.29008665 0.05502003 0.18224936  0.3979239    3     none  identity
#> 7  0.11993079 0.03651545 0.04836184  0.1914998    3     none  identity
#> 8  0.08120193 0.02656267 0.02914006  0.1332638    3     none  identity

#> 10 0.08403060 0.02343156 0.03810559  0.1299556    3     none  identity
